text: The Transcription Factor <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Mediates Constitutive and LPS - Inducible Transcription of Murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>

<extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> plasminogen activator inhibitor type 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> PAI-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is highly induced in macrophages in response to inflammatory stimuli and is linked to the modulation of innate immunity , macrophage survival , and inhibition of plasminogen activators .

Lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) , a potent bacterial endotoxin , can induce <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression via the <extra_id_0> toll-like receptor 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) by ~1000-fold over a period of 24 hrs in murine macrophages .

To map the LPS - regulated <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter regions , we transfected reporter constructs driven by the ~5 kb 5'-flanking region of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene and several deletion mutants into murine macrophages .

In addition , we compared the DNA sequence of the murine 5 ' flanking sequence with the sequence of the human gene for homologous functional regulatory elements and identified several regulatory cis - acting elements in the human <extra_id_0> SERPINB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter conserved in the mouse .

Mutation analyses revealed that a CCAAT enhancer binding ( C / EBP ) element , a cyclic AMP response element ( CRE ) and two activator protein 1 ( AP-1 ) response elements in the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter are essential for optimal LPS-inducibility .

Electrophoretic mobility shift ( EMSA ) and chromatin immunoprecipitation ( ChIP ) assays demonstrated that LPS induces the formation of <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> containing complexes with the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

Importantly , both constitutive and LPS - induced <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was severely abrogated in <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - null mouse embryonic fibroblasts ( MEFs ) and primary <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient peritoneal macrophages .

Together , these data provide new insight into <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent regulation of inflammation - associated <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
